decks.notes: The key concept of this deck is to control the game by countering opponent's spells and disrupting their strategy with cards like Mystical Dispute, Aether Gust, and Negate. The deck also aims to generate card advantage and mana advantage with Growth Spiral and Wilderness Reclamation, allowing the player to cast powerful spells like Expansion/Explosion and Shark Typhoon. Additionally, the deck has a versatile win condition in Kenrith, the Returned King, who can provide various benefits such as gaining life, drawing cards, or giving creatures haste.

This mono black aggro deck focuses on quickly overwhelming the opponent with a mix of low-cost creatures and removal spells. The key concept of the deck is to apply constant pressure, utilizing efficient creatures like Knight of the Ebon Legion and Hunted Nightmare to deal damage and disrupt the opponent's strategy. The deck also includes powerful removal spells like Heartless Act to control the board state. Through a combination of aggression and disruption, this deck aims to dominate the battlefield and swiftly defeat the opponent.

This deck focuses on using the Aggro strategy, aiming to win the game quickly and aggressively. The key concept revolves around utilizing the companion card Jegantha, the Wellspring and the commander Winota, Joiner of Forces. The deck includes a combination of powerful creatures, such as Venerated Loxodon, Basri's Lieutenant, and Judith, the Scourge Diva, along with various removal options like Woe Strider and Kitesail Freebooter. Additionally, it includes some popular land choices and support cards like Selfless Savior and Raise the Alarm to further enhance its aggressive nature.

The main concept of this deck is to establish control over the game through powerful counterspells and removal spells while generating card advantage and value through card draw and token generation. Utilizing cards like Wilderness Reclamation and Shark Typhoon to maintain board presence and pressure the opponent, while using cards like Aether Gust and Mystical Dispute to disrupt the opponent's game plan. The deck aims to outvalue the opponent and establish a dominant board state, ultimately leading to victory in the long game.

The key concept of this deck is to control the game through countering opponent's spells and interacting at instant speed while ramping up mana with Wilderness Reclamation. The deck aims to out-value the opponent by generating card advantage with cards like Uro, Titan of Nature's Wrath and Shark Typhoon, and finish the game with powerful X spells like Expansion / Explosion. The deck utilizes lands that can provide any color of mana to ensure smooth mana base, while also having access to cards like Aether Gust and Blast Zone to deal with opponent's threats.

This deck focuses on controlling the board through sacrificing creatures and generating value from them. By utilizing cards like Cauldron Familiar, Woe Strider, and Mayhem Devil in combination with Witch's Oven and Trail of Crumbs, the deck can consistently generate advantage. Bolas's Citadel provides a powerful win condition while cards like Priest of Forgotten Gods and Claim the Firstborn disrupt the opponent's strategy. The deck also includes ramp with Gilded Goose and Solemn Simulacrum, as well as a strong finisher in Korvold, Fae-Cursed King. It aims to outvalue and outlast opponents through resource management and incremental advantage.

The main focus of this deck is to control the game using Wilderness Reclamation to untap lands and generate mana, while also using counterspells like Mystical Dispute and Dovin's Veto to disrupt the opponent's plans. Shark Typhoon and Expansion / Explosion provide alternate win conditions, while Uro, Titan of Nature's Wrath and Teferi, Time Raveler provide card advantage and tempo advantage. The deck also includes a mix of land cards to ensure consistent mana sources and access to all necessary colors. Overall, the deck aims to outvalue and outmaneuver the opponent through efficient control strategies.

The primary strategy of this deck is to establish control over the game by consistently disrupting opponents' plays with counterspells and removal spells while generating card advantage through passive card draw effects and powerful planeswalkers. The deck aims to stall the game until it can establish a dominant board presence with powerful threats like Shark Typhoon and Archon of Sun's Grace. Yorion, Sky Nomad serves as a versatile companion that can provide significant value by blinking permanents for additional effects. Overall, this deck focuses on controlling the pace of the game and outvaluing opponents over time.

This deck focuses on controlling the opponent's actions through counterspells and removal spells while ramping up mana with cards like Growth Spiral and Wilderness Reclamation. The game plan is to control the board until the late game, where powerful threats like Uro, Titan of Nature's Wrath and Shark Typhoon can take over. Teferi, Time Raveler provides disruption and card advantage, while Nissa, Who Shakes the World can quickly ramp up mana production. The deck aims to outvalue the opponent with efficient spells and powerful threats to secure a victory.

This deck revolves around controlling the game by countering and removing the opponent's threats while gaining card advantage. The main win condition is using Wilderness Reclamation to generate extra mana and cast powerful spells like Expansion / Explosion and Shark Typhoon, which create additional threats and can finish off the opponent. The deck also features a small planeswalker package with Narset, Parter of Veils providing card filtering and Nissa, Who Shakes the World generating extra mana and powering up your lands. Overall, the key concept is to control the game and outvalue the opponent.

The main concept of this deck is to maintain control over the game by utilizing counterspells, card draw, and powerful planeswalkers like Teferi, Time Raveler. The deck aims to ramp up its mana with cards like Growth Spiral and Wilderness Reclamation, and eventually overwhelm the opponent with cards like Shark Typhoon and Expansion / Explosion. The deck also includes threats like Uro, Titan of Nature's Wrath and Kenrith, the Returned King to provide flexibility and additional win conditions. Land consistency is achieved through a mix of various mana-fixing lands to ensure smooth gameplay.

The key strategy of this deck is to control the game by utilizing counterspells and removal spells while ramping up mana with Wilderness Reclamation and Growth Spiral. This allows the player to play powerful threats like Uro, Titan of Nature's Wrath and Shark Typhoon while still being able to leave up mana for interaction. The goal is to outvalue the opponent with card advantage and efficient plays, while also being able to end the game with a large Explosion or a flurry of shark tokens.

This Jund control deck focuses on resource management, sacrificing and recurring creatures, and generating value from sacrificing food tokens. The deck utilizes cards like Witch's Oven, Gilded Goose, Trail of Crumbs, and Cauldron Familiar to create a loop of sacrificing and generating food tokens. Mayhem Devil and Woe Strider provide a means of dealing damage and controlling the board through sacrificing. Bolas's Citadel allows for additional card advantage and potential combo finishes. Priest of Forgotten Gods and Claim the Firstborn offer additional sacrifice and disruption options. Korvold, Fae-Cursed King and Llanowar Visionary provide card draw and ramp.

The key concept of this deck is to control the game by countering opponent's spells with cards like Aether Gust, Mystical Dispute, and Negate. It also aims to ramp up its mana with Growth Spiral and Wilderness Reclamation to play powerful spells like Expansion / Explosion and Shark Typhoon. The deck includes cards like Uro, Titan of Nature's Wrath and Nightpack Ambusher for additional threats and value. The mana base is designed to support all three colors (blue, green, and red) and includes versatile lands like Fabled Passage and Ketria Triome.

The main focus of this deck is to control the game by utilizing cards like Wilderness Reclamation and Shark Typhoon to generate value and create threats. The deck aims to ramp up quickly with cards like Growth Spiral and Uro, Titan of Nature's Wrath, while also disrupting the opponent's game plan with counterspells like Mystical Dispute and Negate. The inclusion of cards like Jolrael, Mwonvuli Recluse adds to the deck's versatility and helps in creating additional win conditions. By effectively managing resources and controlling the board, this deck aims to outlast the opponent and secure victory.

This deck focuses on control through countering opponent's spells and generating card advantage with cards like Growth Spiral and Wilderness Reclamation. It aims to control the game until it can overwhelm the opponent with powerful spells like Expansion / Explosion and Shark Typhoon. The deck also includes threats like Uro, Titan of Nature's Wrath and Brazen Borrower to provide pressure and close out the game. The mana base is carefully constructed to provide the right colors and flexibility for casting spells efficiently.

The main concept of this deck is to establish control over the game by utilizing powerful counter spells and removal options, while also ramping up mana with cards like Growth Spiral and Wilderness Reclamation. The deck aims to control the opponent's plays with cards like Teferi, Time Raveler and Mystical Dispute, while also generating card advantage with Expansion / Explosion. The win condition comes from generating a large army of Shark tokens with Shark Typhoon or overwhelming the opponent with a big Explosion. This deck focuses on controlling the board and outvaluing the opponent.

The main focus of this deck is to use Wilderness Reclamation to untap lands and generate additional mana, while controlling the board with counter spells and removal. Shark Typhoon and Uro, Titan of Nature's Wrath provide additional threats and card advantage. The deck also includes card draw and ramp spells like Growth Spiral to ensure consistent mana development. The goal is to outvalue the opponent by efficiently managing resources and overwhelming them with powerful spells and creatures.

This deck focuses on quickly overwhelming the opponent with aggressive creatures and sacrificing them for value. The goal is to maintain a steady stream of damage and disruption by utilizing cards like Claim the Firstborn, Witch's Oven, and Priest of Forgotten Gods. Utilizing sacrifice synergies with cards like Cauldron Familiar and Mayhem Devil, while also generating card advantage with cards like Midnight Reaper and Village Rites. The inclusion of Jegantha provides additional flexibility and mana fixing. Overall, this deck aims to apply relentless pressure and grind out advantage through sacrificing creatures.

The deck focuses on gaining control of the game through card advantage and counter spells, while using powerful win conditions like Uro, Titan of Nature's Wrath and Shark Typhoon. It aims to ramp up mana with Wilderness Reclamation and Growth Spiral, for explosive plays using Expansion / Explosion. It includes removal in the form of Storm's Wrath and Brazen Borrower, with Aether Gust and Negate to disrupt opponent's game plan. The deck also includes some utility lands like Castle Vantress and Blast Zone to deal with threats on the battlefield.

The deck focuses on utilizing Wilderness Reclamation to generate large amounts of mana during the opponent's end step, allowing for explosive plays with Expansion / Explosion. The deck also aims to control the board with counterspells like Negate and Mystical Dispute, while generating card advantage with Growth Spiral. Shark Typhoon provides a win condition that can create a massive flying shark token, while additional threats like Uro, Titan of Nature's Wrath and Nightpack Ambusher help to apply pressure on the opponent. Castle Vantress provides additional card selection and potential late-game advantage.

The deck focuses on utilizing powerful planeswalkers like Nicol Bolas, Dragon-God and Teferi, Time Raveler to control the game and limit the opponent's resources. Cards like Narset, Parter of Veils and Atris, Oracle of Half-Truths help disrupt the opponent's strategy while drawing cards for advantage. Removal spells like Ritual of Soot and Cry of the Carnarium handle threats on the board, while disruption spells like Duress and Though Erasure help control the opponent's hand. The deck also includes powerful finishers like Elspeth Conquers Death and Liliana, Dreadhorde General to close out the game.

The main idea of this deck is to control the game by ramping up mana with cards like Growth Spiral and Wilderness Reclamation, while countering opponent's spells with Dovin's Veto and Mystical Dispute. The deck also utilizes powerful threats like Shark Typhoon, Nightpack Ambusher, and Uro, Titan of Nature's Wrath to pressure the opponent. The key strategy is to outvalue the opponent by efficiently using resources and card advantage to maintain control of the game and eventually win with a large explosive play like Expansion / Explosion.

The key concept of this deck is to control the game through powerful spells and card advantage, while generating mana advantage with Wilderness Reclamation and Nissa, Who Shakes the World. The deck aims to stall the game with counterspells such as Mystical Dispute and Aether Gust, while ramping and drawing cards with Growth Spiral and Uro, Titan of Nature's Wrath. The win condition is to create massive Shark tokens with Shark Typhoon or burn the opponent out with Expansion / Explosion. The deck aims to outvalue and outlast the opponent until it can secure victory.

The deck focuses on ramping up mana quickly with cards like Growth Spiral and Fabled Passage to cast powerful control spells like Teferi, Time Raveler and Wilderness Reclamation. It also includes counterspells like Mystical Dispute and Dovin's Veto to disrupt the opponent's strategy. The deck aims to control the game with efficient removal spells and card advantage, eventually overwhelming the opponent with large creatures like Shark Typhoon or massive Explosions. It utilizes a three-color mana base to have access to a wide range of spells and options in order to dominate the game.

The key concept of this deck is to control the game by utilizing a combination of counterspells and board wipes to keep the opponent's threats in check. The deck aims to establish a strong defense early on with cards like Teferi, Time Raveler and Elspeth Conquers Death, while also ramping up mana with Growth Spiral and Nissa, Who Shakes the World. This allows the deck to eventually drop powerful threats like Uro, Titan of Nature's Wrath and Hydroid Krasis, providing card advantage and stabilization while continuing to control the board.

The key concept of this Rakdos Aggro deck is to create a fast and aggressive playstyle using sacrifice synergy. The deck focuses on stealing and sacrificing opponent's creatures with cards like Claim the Firstborn and Call of the Death-Dweller. It also utilizes the combination of Witch's Oven and Cauldron Familiar to generate value and trigger abilities like Mayhem Devil's ping effect. The deck includes efficient and aggressive creatures like Dreadhorde Butcher and Gutterbones, as well as cards like Priest of Forgotten Gods and Woe Strider for additional sacrifice options.

This deck focuses on controlling the game through a combination of powerful planeswalkers, counterspells, and removal spells. By utilizing cards like Teferi, Time Raveler and Elspeth Conquers Death to disrupt the opponent's strategy, while also ramping up mana with Growth Spiral and Nissa, Who Shakes the World to play big threats like Hydroid Krasis and Uro, Titan of Nature's Wrath. The deck aims to outvalue the opponent through card advantage and efficient removal, ultimately leading to victory through attrition and overwhelming board presence.

The main concept of this deck is to play a control strategy using the colors of Temur (red, green, blue) to control the game and maximize resources. The deck focuses on using cards like Teferi, Time Raveler, Wilderness Reclamation, and Shark Typhoon to control the board and generate card advantage. It also includes cards like Growth Spiral and Uro, Titan of Nature's Wrath to ramp and gain life. The deck further includes counterspells like Mystical Dispute and Dovin's Veto to protect its plans and disrupt the opponent's strategies. Overall, the deck aims to control the game and generate value over time.

The deck focuses on overwhelming the opponent with a swarm of small creatures that can quickly build up and overpower the opposing player. By utilizing cards like Venerated Loxodon and Glorious Anthem to boost the power and toughness of your creatures, as well as cards like Raise the Alarm and Garrison Cat to quickly populate the board, the deck aims to apply early pressure and maintain a strong board presence. Additionally, cards like Unbreakable Formation and Selfless Savior provide protection for your creatures, allowing you to sustain your assault and keep the pressure on your opponent.

This deck focuses on the strategy of quickly deploying powerful creatures onto the battlefield to overwhelm the opponent with early aggression. By utilizing efficient creatures like Questing Beast and Stonecoil Serpent along with support cards like Primal Might and Lovestruck Beast, it aims to maintain a fast-paced tempo and deal damage quickly. The inclusion of powerful planeswalkers like Nissa, Who Shakes the World and Vivien, Arkbow Ranger provides additional versatility and card advantage, while the mana base of Forests and utility lands ensures consistent mana production for explosive plays.

The main focus of this deck is to control the game through spells like Mystical Dispute and Wilderness Reclamation, while also ramping up mana with Growth Spiral and Fabled Passage. The deck aims to generate value through cards like Uro, Titan of Nature's Wrath and Shark Typhoon, eventually closing out the game with explosive finishers like Expansion / Explosion or Commence the Endgame. With a mix of counter spells, removal, and card draw, the deck aims to outlast opponents and establish dominance in the late game.

The deck focuses on controlling the game through a combination of powerful planeswalkers like Teferi, Time Raveler and Nissa, Who Shakes the World, along with board wipes like Shatter the Sky. It also utilizes efficient counterspells like Mystical Dispute and Dovin's Veto to disrupt opponent's plans. The deck aims to ramp up with Growth Spiral and Uro, Titan of Nature's Wrath to eventually overwhelm the opponent with large threats like Hydroid Krasis. The mana base is carefully constructed to support the deck's multicolored spells and ensure smooth mana progression throughout the game.

The primary focus of this deck is to aggressively swarm the board with low-cost creatures and overwhelm the opponent with a combination of direct damage, discard effects, and powerful equipment spells like Embercleave. By efficiently using the mana base and a mix of creatures with strong abilities such as lifelink, haste, and menace, this deck aims to win quickly and decisively. The inclusion of removal spells like Heartless Act and disruption with cards like Drill Bit and Kitesail Freebooter adds versatility and ensures the deck can handle a variety of threats.

The key concept of this deck is to control the game by using counterspells and removal spells to disrupt the opponent's game plan. It aims to maintain control of the board by playing creatures like Uro, Titan of Nature's Wrath and Brazen Borrower for additional value. The deck also utilizes Wilderness Reclamation and Growth Spiral to ramp up mana and draw cards, allowing for explosive turns of casting powerful spells like Expansion / Explosion and Shark Typhoon. The deck's mana base is designed to support the three-color strategy, ensuring consistency in casting spells of different colors.

The deck focuses on using Wilderness Reclamation to generate extra mana during the opponent's turn, allowing for powerful instant speed plays with cards like Shark Typhoon and Expansion/Explosion. The goal is to control the board with counterspells like Mystical Dispute and Negate while deploying threats like Nightpack Ambusher and Uro, Titan of Nature's Wrath to close out the game. The deck aims to outvalue opponents by utilizing its resources efficiently and playing at instant speed to disrupt the opponent's game plan.

The main concept of this deck is to control the game through countering opponent's spells and removing threats with Aether Gust and Brazen Borrower. The deck aims to ramp up mana quickly with Growth Spiral and Wilderness Reclamation to play powerful spells like Expansion / Explosion and Shark Typhoon. Uro, Titan of Nature's Wrath provides card advantage and life gain while Commence the Endgame gives a finisher option. The deck has a good mix of counterspells, removal, and card draw to outvalue opponents and win through attrition.

The key concept of this deck is to control the game by using a combination of counterspells, removal, and card advantage. It aims to control the board and disrupt the opponent's game plan by countering their spells and removing their threats. The deck also utilizes Wilderness Reclamation and Growth Spiral to generate mana advantage and maintain a steady stream of cards. It can win the game through card advantage and tempo swings with Explosion, as well as through the use of Shark Typhoon and Nightpack Ambusher to create a substantial board presence.

The main concept of this deck is to control the game by manipulating the opponent's actions and maintaining resource advantage. This is achieved through cards like Teferi, Time Raveler, Shark Typhoon, and Mystical Dispute to disrupt the opponent's game plan and protect your own. The deck aims to generate extra mana with Wilderness Reclamation and Growth Spiral to cast powerful spells like Expansion / Explosion. Uro, Titan of Nature's Wrath and Brazen Borrower provide additional value and interaction. The deck also has various lands to support its strategy and provide flexibility in gameplay.

The deck focuses on establishing control through counterspells, card draw, and land ramp, while using powerful spells and creatures to win the game. Wilderness Reclamation allows for explosive turns, while Shark Typhoon provides both a win condition and defense. Expansion / Explosion and Uro, Titan of Nature's Wrath offer flexible options for card advantage and damage. The deck's aim is to control the game's pace with counter magic, develop a strong board presence with creatures like Nightpack Ambusher, and finish off the opponent with powerful spells. The lands are optimized for smooth mana progression and utility.

The key concept of this deck is to control the game by countering opponent's spells, disrupting their strategy, and generating card advantage through ramp and card draw. This is achieved through a combination of powerful control cards like Mystical Dispute, Negate, and Aether Gust, as well as utilizing cards like Wilderness Reclamation and Shark Typhoon to generate value and overwhelm the opponent. The deck aims to stabilize the board with cards like Uro, Titan of Nature's Wrath and Nightpack Ambusher, while setting up for a strong finish with cards like Expansion / Explosion.

The main focus of this deck is to control the game by utilizing counterspells and removal spells to disrupt your opponent's strategy. The deck also aims to generate card advantage through cards like Uro, Titan of Nature's Wrath and Growth Spiral, while ramping up mana with Wilderness Reclamation. The win condition for this deck revolves around resolving an Expansion / Explosion or using Shark Typhoon to create a massive flying threat. By efficiently controlling the game and having strong finishers, this deck aims to outvalue and outlast its opponents.

The main focus of this deck is to control the game through counterspells, removal, and card advantage while utilizing Wilderness Reclamation to generate mana and cast powerful spells like Expansion / Explosion and Shark Typhoon. The deck aims to ramp up quickly with cards like Growth Spiral and Uro, Titan of Nature's Wrath, allowing it to overwhelm opponents with card advantage and threats while keeping the opponent's board in check with counterspells and removal spells like Aether Gust and Brazen Borrower. The goal is to out-value the opponent and eventually finish them off with powerful spells or creatures.

The key focus of this deck is to control the game with counterspells, removal, and card draw until it can establish a dominant board presence with Wilderness Reclamation and Shark Typhoon. By utilizing powerful instant speed spells like Expansion / Explosion and Mystical Dispute, as well as ramping with Growth Spiral, the deck aims to outvalue and outmaneuver the opponent. Once the engine is online, it can generate a huge advantage with cards like Uro, Titan of Nature's Wrath and Jolrael, Mwonvuli Recluse to overwhelm the opponent and secure the win.

This deck focuses on controlling the game through countering spells and disrupting the opponent's game plan. By utilizing Wilderness Reclamation and Shark Typhoon, the deck generates card advantage and creates threats on the board. The combination of counter spells like Mystical Dispute and Negate, along with removal options like Aether Gust and Brazen Borrower, allows the player to maintain control of the game until they can close it out with powerful finishers like Expansion / Explosion and Uro, Titan of Nature's Wrath.

The deck focuses on maintaining control over the game by using powerful planeswalkers like Teferi, Time Raveler and Nissa, Who Shakes the World, along with removal spells like Elspeth Conquers Death and Shatter the Sky to control the board. It also utilizes card draw and mana ramp with cards like Growth Spiral and Uro, Titan of Nature's Wrath to maintain card advantage and accelerate its mana base. The deck aims to outvalue and outlast opponents with its versatile threats like Hydroid Krasis and Shark Typhoon while disrupting their game plan with counterspells like Dovin's Veto.

The key concept of this deck is to control the game using counterspells and removal spells in order to stabilize the board and prevent the opponent from executing their game plan. It utilizes Wilderness Reclamation to generate additional mana and allow for multiple spells to be cast in a single turn. The deck also aims to draw additional cards and ramp with cards like Growth Spiral and Uro, Titan of Nature's Wrath. Finally, it utilizes Expansion / Explosion and Shark Typhoon as finishers to close out the game.

The key concept of this Bant Control deck is to dominate the game through resource management, disruption, and card advantage. It aims to control the board and deny opponents' strategies by utilizing counterspells such as Dovin's Veto and Aether Gust, removal spells like Shatter the Sky and Elspeth Conquers Death, and card draw with Growth Spiral and Uro, Titan of Nature's Wrath. Additionally, it plans to generate massive value with cards like Hydroid Krasis, Shark Typhoon, and Teferi, Time Raveler. The deck also maximizes mana with the help of Nissa, Who Shakes the World and land cards like Fabled Passage and Temple Garden.

This Bant Control deck focuses on utilizing powerful planeswalkers like Teferi, Narset, and Nissa to control the board and disrupt the opponent's strategy. It also includes removal spells like Elspeth Conquers Death and counterspells like Dovin's Veto and Mystical Dispute to protect your own threats. The deck aims to ramp up quickly with cards like Growth Spiral and Uro, Titan of Nature's Wrath, while also generating value with cards like Hydroid Krasis and Shark Typhoon. Overall, the deck aims to control the game until you can overwhelm your opponent with powerful threats.

This deck focuses on quickly building a board presence and controlling the game through disruption spells. By using efficient creatures like Seasoned Hallowblade and Rotting Regisaur, along with disruptive cards like Tithe Taker and Teferi, Time Raveler, the deck aims to pressure opponents while denying them opportunities to develop their own strategies. The deck also includes powerful sideboard options like Aether Gust and Dovin's Veto to further control the pace of the game and ensure victory through aggressive and disruptive plays.

The deck focuses on utilizing sacrifice synergies to control the board and generate value. By sacrificing creatures like Cauldron Familiar and Woe Strider with Priest of Forgotten Gods, players can trigger abilities like Mayhem Devil's ping effect and Korvold's card draw. Witch's Oven and Trail of Crumbs provide additional sources of recursion and card advantage. With the ability to generate incremental advantages through sacrificing and recurring creatures, the deck can grind out opponents while maintaining control of the game state.

The main focus of this deck is to overwhelm the opponent with powerful, efficient creatures and quick, aggressive plays. With a strong mana base and a lineup of resilient creatures like Lovestruck Beast, Questing Beast, and Stonecoil Serpent, this deck aims to apply pressure early and often. By utilizing cards like Giant Growth and Gemrazer to pump up creatures and disrupt opponents' strategies, the deck aims to finish the game quickly before the opponent can mount a defense. With a focus on speed and brute force, this Mono Green Aggro deck aims to dominate the battlefield and overwhelm opponents with raw power.

The deck focuses on managing your opponent's threats through counterspells, bounce effects, and removal spells while ramping up your own resources with cards like Growth Spiral and Wilderness Reclamation. Nightpack Ambusher and Shark Typhoon provide threats of your own, while Teferi, Time Raveler disrupts your opponent's game plan. Uro, Titan of Nature's Wrath helps with card advantage and gaining life, and Expansion/Explosion can be a finisher or a card draw engine. The mana base allows for flexibility in casting your spells efficiently.

The main concept of this deck is to maintain control of the game by using counterspells, removal, and card advantage, while also generating value through ramp and card draw. The deck aims to stall the game out with cards like Nightpack Ambusher and Wilderness Reclamation, before eventually overwhelming the opponent with powerful spells and threats like Uro, Titan of Nature's Wrath and Shark Typhoon. The mana base is carefully crafted to ensure consistent access to all three colors of mana needed to cast the spells in the deck.

This deck focuses on controlling the game by using powerful cards like Teferi, Time Raveler and Wilderness Reclamation to stay ahead of the opponent. It also utilizes counter spells like Mystical Dispute and Negate to disrupt the opponent's strategy. The deck aims to generate card advantage with cards like Expansion / Explosion and Uro, Titan of Nature's Wrath while also creating threats with Shark Typhoon. The mana base is carefully constructed to ensure that the player has access to all the necessary colors to cast their spells effectively.

The key concept of this deck is to control the game by countering opponents' spells and disrupting their plans while generating card advantage and mana advantage through Wilderness Reclamation and Growth Spiral. The deck aims to maintain card draw and board presence with Shark Typhoon and Uro, Titan of Nature's Wrath while providing additional interaction and flexibility with Expansion / Explosion, Mystical Dispute, Negate, and Aether Gust. The deck also includes some threats like Brazen Borrower, Nightpack Ambusher, and Commence the Endgame to apply pressure and close out games. The mana base is designed to support the deck's color requirements and provide flexibility in casting spells.

The main objective of this deck is to control the game through powerful spells and counters, while ramping up mana with cards like Wilderness Reclamation and Growth Spiral to cast big threats like Shark Typhoon and Uro, Titan of Nature's Wrath. The deck utilizes a variety of instant-speed cards to respond to threats and maintain board control, with multiple ways to win the game through burn damage or overwhelming the opponent with tokens. The mana base is carefully crafted to allow for smooth color access and consistent ramping.

The key focus of this deck is to overwhelm the opponent with a swarm of low-cost creatures that synergize with each other. The deck is built around the idea of playing small, efficient creatures that can quickly flood the board and benefit from cards like Glorious Anthem, which boosts the power and toughness of all creatures under your control. This aggressive strategy aims to put constant pressure on the opponent and capitalize on their inability to deal with a large number of threats simultaneously.

The primary focus of this deck is to control the game by utilizing various counterspells and disruption tools. It aims to maintain board presence and card advantage by playing cards like Wilderness Reclamation, Growth Spiral, and Shark Typhoon. The deck utilizes the versatile spells Expansion / Explosion and Mystical Dispute to further control the game and deal damage to opponents. The inclusion of Kenrith, the Returned King provides additional flexibility and utility. The deck also includes a variety of lands to ensure consistent access to all necessary colors of mana.

The main concept of this deck is to control the game through the use of control spells and card advantage, while also setting up a strong late-game win condition. It achieves this by using cards like Wilderness Reclamation and Growth Spiral to ramp and generate card advantage, while countering opponent's spells with Mystical Dispute and Negate. The deck includes powerful threats like Nissa, Who Shakes the World, Uro, Titan of Nature's Wrath, and Shark Typhoon to dominate the late game. Additionally, Nightpack Ambusher and Brazen Borrower provide value and disruption.

The deck focuses on controlling the game through counterspells and removal while ramping up mana with Wilderness Reclamation and Growth Spiral. It utilizes Teferi, Time Raveler to disrupt opponent's plays and protect its own spells. The win condition is often through Shark Typhoon tokens or card advantage from Expansion / Explosion. Uro, Titan of Nature's Wrath provides both card advantage and life gain, while Brazen Borrower offers tempo plays. The deck's land base ensures it can consistently cast its spells and activate its utility lands.

The main concept of this UW Control deck is to gain control of the game by countering opponent's spells, clearing the board, and generating card advantage. It achieves this through a combination of powerful planeswalkers like Narset, Parter of Veils and Teferi, Time Raveler, efficient removal spells like Shatter the Sky and Elspeth Conquers Death, and card draw and filtering with Omen of the Sea. The deck aims to establish a dominant position on the board by utilizing Shark Typhoon tokens and Archon of Sun's Grace.

The main focus of this deck is to overwhelm the opponent with a swarm of low-cost creatures and enhance their power with anthem effects. Utilizing aggressive creatures like Garrison Cat and Seasoned Hallowblade, along with anthem effects such as Glorious Anthem and Basri's Solidarity, the goal is to quickly build a wide board presence and deal significant damage to the opponent. Protection and resilience are also important, as seen with cards like Selfless Savior and Unbreakable Formation to ensure the weenies can continue their assault effectively.

The main focus of this deck is to aggressively play creatures with a low mana cost and quickly build up a strong board presence. With cards like Pelt Collector and Barkhide Troll, along with powerful support from Vivien, Arkbow Ranger and Nissa, Who Shakes the World, this deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with fast and efficient creature plays. The inclusion of removal spells like Ram Through and Scavenging Ooze helps maintain control of the battlefield, while threats like Questing Beast provide additional pressure for the opponent to deal with.

This Sultai Control deck focuses on disrupting the opponent's strategy and maintaining control of the game. It features cards like Narset, Parter of Veils and Thought Distortion to limit the opponent's card advantage, while also utilizing counter spells like Aether Gust to stall their game plan. The deck also includes powerful threats like Hydroid Krasis and Uro, Titan of Nature's Wrath to generate card advantage and gain life. Additionally, it uses removal spells like Eliminate and Extinction Event to deal with the opponent's creatures. Overall, the deck aims to outvalue and outlast the opponent in a long game.

The key concept of this deck is to control the game through counterspells, removal, and card draw while generating value with cards like Uro, Titan of Nature's Wrath and Wilderness Reclamation. The deck aims to disrupt the opponent's game plan and win the game through incremental advantages and powerful late-game plays like Shark Typhoon and Expansion / Explosion. By efficiently managing resources and out-valuing opponents, this deck looks to outlast and outplay opponents in order to secure victory.

The deck focuses on utilizing powerful control cards like Teferi, Time Raveler, Narset, Parter of Veils, and Elspeth Conquers Death to disrupt the opponent's game plan. It also aims to ramp up its mana with cards like Growth Spiral and Nissa, Who Shakes the World in order to cast big threats like Uro, Titan of Nature's Wrath and Hydroid Krasis. The deck also includes cards like Shark Typhoon and Boon of the Wish-Giver to generate card advantage and pressure the opponent. Overall, the deck aims to control the game through disruption, mana ramp, and big threats.

The primary focus of this deck is to control the game by countering opponent's spells and disrupting their strategy while ramping up mana to cast powerful spells like Teferi, Expansion/Explosion, and Shark Typhoon. With Wilderness Reclamation, the deck can generate an abundance of mana to consistently hold up counterspells and draw cards. Uro provides additional card advantage and life gain, while Brazen Borrower offers a versatile removal option. The deck aims to outvalue the opponent by efficiently controlling the board and overwhelming them with card advantage and powerful spells.

The main focus of this deck is to control the game through using counterspells and removal spells, while ramping up mana to cast powerful spells like Shark Typhoon and Expansion/Explosion. The deck also aims to take advantage of Wilderness Reclamation to generate mana during the opponent's turn. Uro, Titan of Nature's Wrath allows for card advantage and life gain, while Brazen Borrower and Nightpack Ambusher provide tempo plays. The deck's mana base is designed to support a variety of different color requirements for its spells.

The main focus of this deck is to control the game through countering opponent's spells, drawing cards, and generating mana advantage. Using cards like Negate, Mystical Dispute, and Aether Gust to disrupt the opponent's game plan, while utilizing Wilderness Reclamation to double up on mana generation. Uro, Titan of Nature's Wrath and Shark Typhoon provide card advantage and threats on the board. The deck aims to outvalue the opponent by efficiently countering their threats and ramping into powerful spells like Expansion / Explosion.

The central idea of this deck is to control the game by using a combination of countermagic and land acceleration. It focuses on playing spells at instant speed during the opponent's turn, utilizing cards like Wilderness Reclamation and Growth Spiral to quickly develop mana and draw cards. The deck also includes powerful finishers such as Shark Typhoon, Expansion / Explosion, and Uro, Titan of Nature's Wrath. With a mix of counter spells, removal, and card advantage, the deck aims to outlast and outvalue its opponents, ultimately winning through overwhelming card advantage and powerful threats.

The focus of this deck is on controlling the game through a combination of removal spells, counterspells, and powerful planeswalkers. The deck aims to delay the opponent's strategy with cards like Teferi, Time Raveler and Aether Gust, while ramping up its own mana with Growth Spiral and Nissa, Who Shakes the World. It also utilizes powerful finishers like Shark Typhoon and Hydroid Krasis to close out the game. This deck seeks to outvalue and outlast the opponent by efficiently answering threats and generating incremental advantage over time.

A control deck focused on utilizing powerful planeswalkers like Teferi and Nissa, along with efficient removal spells like Shatter the Sky and Elspeth Conquers Death. The deck aims to control the board with counterspells like Dovin's Veto and generate card advantage with cards like Shark Typhoon and Hydroid Krasis. Additionally, it has ramp cards like Growth Spiral to accelerate into its threats. Overall, the deck is designed to disrupt the opponent's game plan while establishing a strong board presence through its versatile and resilient cards.
